title: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw Criticizes Google's App Removal in India
description: Google's decision to remove certain apps from its Indian app store has drawn criticism from IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The dispute arises from Google's in-app payment guidelines. Startups like Matrimony.com and Naukri are affected, facing potential revenue loss. The removals highlight ongoing tensions between Indian startups and Google over fee policies.
orderList: Google's app removal criticized by IT Minister
Dispute over in-app payment guidelines
Startups like Matrimony.com and Naukri affected
Tensions between Indian startups and Google

title: Google Pixel Watch 3 to Introduce Larger Size Variant, Pixel Buds Pro 2 in Development
description: The upcoming Google Pixel Watch 3 will include a larger 45mm size variant alongside the traditional 41mm model. This update addresses user requests for a larger watch size. Additionally, Google is reportedly working on the Pixel Buds Pro 2, the successor to its Pixel Buds Pro earphones.
orderList: Pixel Watch 3 to offer larger 45mm size variant
Addressing user requests for larger watch size
Pixel Buds Pro 2 in development as successor to Pixel Buds Pro

title: Embracer Group to Sell Saber Interactive in $500 Million Deal
description: Embracer Group AB plans to sell Saber Interactive, one of its major subsidiaries, to private investors for up to $500 million. Saber, known for games like Snowrunner and World War Z, will continue developing a remake of Star Wars: The Knights of the Old Republic. The deal is part of Embracer's cost-cutting initiative.
orderList: Embracer Group to sell Saber Interactive for up to $500 million
Saber to continue Star Wars: The Knights of the Old Republic remake
Part of Embracer's cost-cutting initiative

title: Apple Scraps MicroLED Display for Apple Watch Ultra, Employees Laid Off
description: Apple has reportedly cancelled its microLED display project for the Apple Watch Ultra due to economic viability concerns. Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo revealed that Apple struggled to justify the high production costs. Several employees from the development team have been laid off. The cancellation marks a significant setback for Apple's display technology ambitions.
orderList: Apple cancels microLED display project for Apple Watch Ultra
Economic viability concerns cited as reason for cancellation
Layoffs reported among development team
Setback for Apple's display technology ambitions

title: X Unveils 'Long-Form Express' for Premium Users to Create and Share Extended Content
description: X, the social networking platform previously known as Twitter, now offers a new feature called Long-Form Express. Exclusive to Premium users, it enables sharing of comprehensive written content. Users can access this feature through the Long-Form Express section, offering diverse formatting options and multimedia embedding capabilities. Articles can span up to 15,000 words and include images, videos, and X posts. They appear on users' profiles and followers' timelines, marked by a distinct icon and layout. Additionally, users have editing and deletion privileges for published articles.
orderList: Exclusive feature for X Premium users
Compose articles with up to 15,000 words
Include multimedia and X posts
Articles appear on profiles and followers' timelines
Users have editing and deletion options

title: iPhone 16 Pro Design Leak Reveals Innovative Capture Button
description: Leaked CAD renders unveil the anticipated iPhone 16 Pro's design, featuring a novel Capture Button alongside significant improvements. The Capture Button, placed below the power button, facilitates seamless photo and video capturing, with additional functionalities like focus adjustment and zoom control. The handset boasts a larger form factor compared to its predecessor, accommodating a 6.3-inch display with thinner bezels. The rear camera setup houses three sensors, a LiDAR module, and enhanced photography capabilities. Expect a sleek design and vibrant colour options upon release.
orderList: Novel Capture Button enhances photo and video capabilities
Larger display with thinner bezels
Advanced rear camera setup for improved photography
Expect sleek design and vibrant colour options

title: Apple Plans Foldable iPhone Launch in 2026, Promising Thin and Light Design
description: Apple is gearing up to release its first foldable iPhone in 2026, aiming for a sleeker and lighter design compared to competitors. The folding device will prioritize durability, minimizing crease marks on the screen. Apple aims to surpass rivals Samsung and Google, known for their existing foldable offerings. The company's focus on cutting-edge technology suggests a game-changing product in the foldables market. Previous rumours hinted at a foldable MacBook, but recent reports indicate Apple's commitment to a foldable iPhone.
orderList: Foldable iPhone launch planned for 2026
Focus on sleek, lightweight design
Priority on durability and screen quality
Aims to surpass competitors like Samsung and Google
